Package game

Class Tile

java.lang.Object
game.Tile
public class Tile extends Object
Tile class. Each tile represents a square on the chess board. Every tile holds onto the rectangle that represents it visually, the piece it holds (if any), the color and outline it is, and the x & y location.
Author:
Jonathan Houge

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      public Tile(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color color, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color outline, int x, int y, int dimensions)
      Constructor. Initialize piece location, tile color, x and y location, and tells piece what each square's width is. Also creates the rectangle that'll visually represent it.
      Parameters:
      color - : color of the tile (black or white)
      outline - : outline of the tile
      x - : tile's x axis location on the canvas
      y - : tile's y axis location on the canvas
      dimensions - : the dimensions of the rectangle (width & height)

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
      Drawing method, default. Makes the background the color of the tile (black or white), fills the tile. Makes the foreground the color of the outline, draws the tile's outline. If there's a piece, draw the piece after the tile.
      Parameters:
      gc - : event gc, let's us draw on the canvas

    • draw

      public void draw(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color newColor)
      Drawing method, special. Makes the background a passed in color (green or cyan), fills the tile. Makes the foreground the color of the outline, draws the tile's outline. If there's a piece, draw the piece after the tile.
      Parameters:
      gc - : event gc, let's us draw on the canvas
      newColor - : new color to draw it, either this tile holds the selected piece or it's a potential for the selected piece to move to.

    • setPiece

      public void setPiece(Piece piece)
      Piece setter. Piece is initially set by ChessBoardUI. Some tiles don't have pieces. Only update piece location if there's an actual piece.
      Parameters:
      piece - : an actual piece or null, if double checks it.

    • hasPiece

      public boolean hasPiece()
      Piece check. Reports back if there's a piece present or not.
      Returns:
      boolean, true if there's a piece, false if there isn't.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece()
      Piece getter. Returns the associated piece.
      Returns:
      piece on this tile.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      toString method. Prints the associated piece (if there is one)
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      toString of the associated piece, if there is one, or null.
